articles.headline: Colts' DeForest Buckner back from IR; Sauce Gardner out again
articles.description: The Colts are getting DT DeForest Buckner back from injured reserve but will be without CB Sauce Gardner again vs. the 49ers on Monday night.

articles.headline: Cowboys activate CB Trevon Diggs ahead of Chargers game
articles.description: The Cowboys activated Trevon Diggs off injured reserve on Saturday, giving the two-time Pro Bowl cornerback the opportunity to play Sunday against the Chargers.

images.name: Stephen A. declares Cowboys' season a failure
images.caption: Stephen A. Smith weighs in on the Cowboys' woes after their loss to the Vikings.

articles.headline: NFL Week 16 predictions, fantasy sleepers, QB notes, bets
articles.description: Fantasy upside for J.J. McCarthy and Tyler Shough? An advantage for the Bears' rushing attack? Upset brewing in Commanders-Eagles? Let's look at Week 16.
articles.byline: Matt Bowen, Pamela Maldonado, Eric Moody, Ben Solak, Seth Walder and NFL Nation

articles.headline: Lions understand it's win or go home the rest of the way
articles.description: Their playoff odds aren't the best, but the Lions say, "There's never a panic with us, we know what we need to do."

images.name: Matthew Stafford [608x342]
images.caption: The Lions surrendered 41 points in last week's loss the Los Angeles Rams.

images.name: Why Rich Eisen believes the Lions can still make the playoffs
images.caption: Rich Eisen believes the Lions can run the table and still make the playoffs despite losing to the Rams in Week 15.

articles.headline: What to make of Ashton Jeanty's rookie season
articles.description: How Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty looked during the 2025 season, and what's next for the running back.

images.name: Ashton Jeanty running vs. Jags [608x342]
images.caption: "... He's done his job. We have to give him more opportunities and more space," coach Pete Carroll said of Ashton Jeanty.

images.name: Ashton Jeanty [608x342]
images.caption: Ashton Jeanty has rushed for 700 yards this season.

images.name: Raiders huddle [608x342]
images.caption: Against the Eagles last week, the Raiders' offense only totaled 75 yards.

images.name: Why Yates predicts Jeanty will score under 10 fantasy points
images.caption: Field Yates breaks down why he has Ashton Jeanty scoring under 10 fantasy points in Week 16.

articles.headline: How Bears DC Dennis Allen has created a takeaway machine
articles.description: The Bears lead the NFL in takeaways differential (plus-20), interceptions (21) and total takeaways (30). Here's why.

images.name: D'Marco Jackson #48 [1296x729]
images.caption: D'Marco Jackson (48) had been cut from the Saints and didn't know where he would land next. But Dennis Allen, who coached Jackson in New Orleans, knew he could help the Bears. Jackson was recently named NFC defensive player of the week.

images.name: Dennis Allen [1296x729]
images.caption: Allen has head coaching experience, and that helped him earn a level of trust among his players.

images.name: Pat McAfee: Are they still the Chicago Bears if they're in Indiana?
images.caption: Pat McAfee reacts to the Bears expanding their stadium search to the state of Indiana.

article.headline: Jalen Hurts rebounds with 3 TD passes as Eagles snap losing streak in 31-0 rout of Raiders
article.description: — Jalen Hurts smacked A.J. Brown helmet-to-helmet after a touchdown pass for a celebration that seemed to release the pent-up tension that came tethered to a losing streak.
article.linkText: Jalen Hurts rebounds with 3 TD passes as Eagles snap losing streak in 31-0 rout of Raiders

images.name: Brandon Graham sacks Kenny Pickett twice
images.caption: Brandon Graham registers two of the Eagles' four sacks in a win over the Raiders.

article.story: PHILADELPHIA -- — Jalen Hurts smacked A.J. Brown helmet-to-helmet after a touchdown pass for a celebration that seemed to release the pent-up tension that came tethered to a losing streak. Nick Sirianni tossed an arm around Hurts and the Philadelphia Eagles coach yelled some happy words at the QB who weathered recent criticism as the season started to bend toward a collapse. The sideline vibes were good for the Eagles. The offense, even better. Against a Las Vegas Raiders team that has bottomed out as one of the worst in the NFL, the defense was simply elite — just 75 total yards allowed. Hurts rebounded from his worst NFL game to throw three touchdown passes, Saquon Barkley had a 2-yard touchdown run and the Eagles snapped a three-game losing streak with their first shutout in seven years in a 31-0 win Sunday. “I feel like we got caught up in stuff that doesn’t matter,” Barkley said. “The only thing that matters is winning football.” The Eagles (9-5) were able to get their maligned offense under embattled coordinator Kevin Patullo right against the woeful Raiders and finally showed signs of life with a nice mix of play calling in bitter cold temperatures and topped 21 points for the first time in six games. Hurts had his moments — that included a shovel pass for a score to Dallas Goedert on a day that started with the field blanketed in several inches of snow. Hurts also hit DeVonta Smith on a 44-yard reception on a drive that stalled in the second quarter and settled for a field goal by Jake Elliott and a 10-0 lead. He pitched a 4-yard TD pass to Goedert in the third for a 24-0 lead. The Eagles defense had their first shutout since Dec. 30, 2018, against Washington. The Eagles limited the Raiders (2-12) to 46 yards rushing and sent them to their eighth straight loss. The Raiders got an anemic performance out of Kenny Pickett in his first start at quarterback for the injured Geno Smith. “This is the result against the world champs last year who maybe weren’t playing quite like that for a month here or whatever, but they looked like it today,” Raiders coach Pete Carroll said. "It looked like a great team today.” Hurts needed a personal win in his first game since he thew four interceptions and lost a fumble in an overtime loss to the Los Angeles Chargers. Hurts’ season has been erratic – he threw five picks against only two touchdowns the last two games, 10 months after he won Super Bowl MVP. Sirianni scoffed at a “ ridiculous ” question on his weekly Philadelphia sports talk radio appearance when he was asked if Hurts would keep his starting job this season. Hurts turned the game into a blowout when he threw a 27-yard touchdown to Brown early in the fourth for a 31-0 lead. He finished 12 of 15 for 175 yards passing. As for the celebration? “Just a natural reaction,” Hurts said through his usual stoicism. The Eagles also staved off talk they were on the brink of their second December collapse under Sirianni in the last three seasons. The 2023 Eagles started 10-1 and finished 11-6 and were bounced in their first playoff game. Hurts and this year’s Eagles have the benefit of a soft schedule down the stretch that started against the Raiders and includes two games with Washington. The Eagles still control the NFC East and have a home playoff game in sight — and yes, they can still repeat as Super Bowl champions, even as Barkley recently criticized the sideline demeanor noted how it seemed “the sky's falling outside the locker room.” Barkley is still well off his 2,000-yards rushing pace from a season ago but added 78 yards rushing and his TD run sent the Eagles into halftime with a 17-0 lead. “We've been committed to playing Eagles football and doing the things we need to do to play Eagles football,” Sirianni said. “That’s tough, detailed, together, and that happens during the week. If we rode the wave of the outside noise, then you’re not able to do that.” Graham breaks through with sacks Brandon Graham had his first two sacks with the Eagles since he ended his short-lived retirement after the Super Bowl and returned to the team in late October. At 37 years, 255 days old, Graham became the oldest player in Eagles history with a sack. Richard Dent was 37 years, 1 day when he had a sack in 1997. “We were just going stingy with everything,” Graham said of the defense's success. Pickett and the Raiders struggle Pickett won a Super Bowl ring last season as Hurts' backup. In his return to Philadelphia, Pickett threw for only 64 yards and was sacked four times. Smith injured his right shoulder and hand in the third quarter of last Sunday’s 24-17 loss to Denver. Smith has a good chance to return next week when the Raiders visit Houston. Carroll offered faint praise: “The only good thing that happened, we didn’t have anybody hurt today.” Hail to the Birds Former President Joe Biden attended the game and told a sports reporter from the local NBC TV station he was rooting for the Eagles. “Go Birds, man, all the way,” Biden said. “Gotta win the Super Bowl again.” Injuries Hurts and Barkley were both checked out by trainers on the sidelines but stayed in the game until the score got out of reach. Both players said after the game they were fine. Up next Raiders: Play Sunday at Houston. Eagles: Play Saturday night in Landover, Maryland, against the Commanders. ------ AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl
